body_html:
@martinwicke @drpngx The C++ kernel ops update is through:

https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/pull/12369/files#diff-9dd26225c3129302e6f60e2b119f48d2R2478

and for python, it is through the __init__() method of the class RecordInput and TFRecordInput:

https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/pull/12369/files#diff-156604dc2cdee8c1c0cd03edb1e8a7fdR2155

https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/pull/12369/files#diff-156604dc2cdee8c1c0cd03edb1e8a7fdR2178

As it is through class constructor, it is not a python ops like decode_raw.

Maybe that is the reason there is no api compatibility issue?

https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/pull/12369/files#diff-9dd26225c3129302e6f60e2b119f48d2R2478
and for python, it is through the __init__() method of the class RecordInput and TFRecordInput:
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/pull/12369/files#diff-156604dc2cdee8c1c0cd03edb1e8a7fdR2155
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/pull/12369/files#diff-156604dc2cdee8c1c0cd03edb1e8a7fdR2178
As it is through class constructor, it is not a python ops like decode_raw.
Maybe that is the reason there is no api compatibility issue?
body:
@martinwicke @drpngx The C++ kernel ops update is through:

https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/pull/12369/files#diff-9dd26225c3129302e6f60e2b119f48d2R2478

and for python, it is through the `__init__()` method of the class `RecordInput` and `TFRecordInput`:

https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/pull/12369/files#diff-156604dc2cdee8c1c0cd03edb1e8a7fdR2155

https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/pull/12369/files#diff-156604dc2cdee8c1c0cd03edb1e8a7fdR2178

As it is through class constructor, it is not a python ops like `decode_raw`.

Maybe that is the reason there is no api compatibility issue?
